text: you ever wondered how the most
successful people get to the top how do
they juggle so many moving Parts how do
their brains seem to operate on a
completely different level it could feel
like they're playing 4D chess while
you're stuck playing Tic-Tac-Toe well
here's the secret the most successful
people aren't born with superhuman
abilities they've simply mastered a set
of six core skills that make them
strategic powerhouses and guess what you
can Master them too these six skills
first introduced by leadership expert
Michael Watkins in his book The Six
disciplines of strategic thinking aren't
just for CEOs or high-powered Executives
they're practical actionable and can
help anyone think smarter and make
better decisions by the end of this
video you'll have a clear understanding
of these skills and how to start
applying them to your own life so what
are we waiting for let's dive in first
up pattern recognition this is your
ability to spot connections and Trends
in the chaos around you they of it like
being the detective in your own life
whether you're Sherlock Holmes solving a
crime or figuring out if your dog is
eating one of your favorite socks
patterns are everywhere identifying and
recognizing them can help you get ahead
let's start with something simple maybe
you notice that every time you skip your
workout you feel sluggish the next day
that's a pattern or maybe you realize
you're more productive when you work in
the morning rather than at night another
pattern the trick is to pay attention
connect the dots and then use the data
you gather to build a routine in life
that works for you journaling or using
habit trackers can help you get better
at paying attention to the Small Things
patterns aren't just in our everyday
lives they often materialize in business
technology culture and the world around
us one example of an expert at pattern
recognition was Steve Jobs he noticed
early on the direction technology was
taking smaller devices better interfaces
and the fast rise of digital media this
is how the iPod was born later the
iPhone Apple is now one of the biggest
leaders in Tech so keep your eyes open
cuz the patterns you spot could lead to
the next big breakthrough next we have
systems analysis this is the ability to
see how all the moving parts fit
together think of it like assembling a
new piece of flat pack Furniture except
maybe without the stress of all those
different screws and the missing Table
leg at the end one expert in this type
of thinking was Henry Ford founder of
the Ford motor company and Pioneer of
affordable Motor Vehicles in the early
20th century Ford introduced the
assembly line a way to build cars that
would completely change the game but
when he introduced this concept he
didn't just think about building cars he
thought about how each step in the
process could be optimized to save time
and money the result cars became more
affordable for the average person
revolutionizing transportation in
America now let's think smaller and
apply systems analysis to your morning
routine
if you wake up 15 minutes earlier how
does that affect the rest of your day
does it give you time to eat breakfast
or prepare better for work systems
analysis is about understanding the
Ripple effects of your actions no matter
how small once you see the big picture
you can make smarter choices to make
changes to the system so why not try
overhauling the way you do things and
might just revolutionize yourself number
three mental agility mental agility is
like being a gymnast but for your brain
it's about staying flexible and adapting
when things don't go as planned when you
get thrown a curveball how do you react
do you panic sulk and give up or do you
roll up your sleeves and try again to
practice being more flexible and
adaptable try taking a different route
to work or say yes to something outside
of your comfort zone the more you expose
yourself to new experiences the more
agile your mind becomes if you found
yourself resonating with anything we've
discussed so far our sponsor betterhelp
is here to support you betterhelp is the
world's largest therapy service and it's
100% online you can message your
therapist at any time and schedule live
sessions when it's convenient for you if
your therapist isn't the right fit for
any reason you can switch to a new
therapist at no additional charge with
better help you get the same
professional and quality you'd expect
from in-office therapy but with a
therapist who's custom picked for you
with more scheduling flexibility and at
a more affordable price betterhelp has a
special offer today where you'll get 10%
off your first month just go to better
help.com slimpro pill number four
structured problem solving structured
problem solving is about breaking big
scary problems into smaller manageable
chunks let's say you're always broke the
week leading up to Payday has always got
you counting pennies instead of
panicking and calling Mom break down the
problem step one track your spending
step two identify any unnecessary
expenses step three create a budget plan
to help solve the issue when you tackle
any problem step by step it becomes a
lot less overwhelming famous inventor
Thomas Edison was the king of problem
solving when he invented the light bulb
he famously said I've not failed I've
just found 10,000 ways that won't work
his methodical and resilient approach
eventually led to one of the most
important inventions in history number
five visioning visioning also known as
visualization is all about imagining a
better future it's like dream and big
but with a clear plan to get there one
of the easiest ways to practice
visioning is by visualizing your goals
and aspirations through a vision board
or Journal be specific don't just say I
want to be successful say I want to
start my own business within 2 years
then reverse engineer the steps to make
it happen need more inspiration one
person who's mastered visioning is Oprah
Winfrey Oprah grew up in poverty and
envisioned a future where she could make
a difference through hard work and a
Clear Vision she became one of the most
influential people in the world so why
not take a page from Oprah's Book what's
your vision dream big write it down and
start taking action today last but not
least be politically Savvy but what does
that mean it's about understanding
people and navigating social dynamics in
ways that'll help you in everyday life
this could mean being a better listener
or paying attention to unspoken rules in
your workplace for example if your boss
is always grumpy before they morning
coffee wait until after they've had
their caffeine to pitch your big idea a
great example of being politically Savvy
comes from the ancient Chinese
strategist sunzu in his famous work The
Art of War he believed that success
didn't come from military strength but
from knowing when to form alliances when
to retreat and how to outmaneuver
opponents through strategic thinking and
diplomacy Sun's wisdom shows that
understanding the people around you and
the environment you're in can often be
more important than power alone so there
we have it the six core skills of
strategic thinking pattern recognition
systems analysis mental agility
structured problem solving visioning and
being politically Savvy they might sound
daunting but they're skills that anyone
can develop start small and write down
ways that you can practice these skills
in your life right now put them into
practice and watch how your life starts
to tr transform before your eyes if you
found this video helpful hit that like
button or share it with a friend got an
interesting tip or skill you swear by
drop it in the comments below and as
ever stay tuned
